intro: Diastatea micrantha var. longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract diastatea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The species is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
